overview.title: Navigation Overview
overview.description: Idealyst provides a unified navigation system that works identically on web and native. Define your routes once with full TypeScript support, and get platform-optimized navigation automatically.

navigatorProvider.title: NavigatorProvider
navigatorProvider.description: Root component that wraps your app and provides navigation context. Pass your route configuration via the route prop.

navigatorParam.title: NavigatorParam
navigatorParam.description: Type for route configuration objects. Supports three layouts: stack, tab, and drawer. Routes can be nested to create complex navigation hierarchies.

useNavigator.title: useNavigator()
useNavigator.description: Hook for programmatic navigation. Provides navigate(), goBack(), and current route information. Works identically on all platforms.

stack.title: Stack
stack.description: Push/pop navigation with back button. Default for most apps.

tab.title: Tab
tab.description: Bottom tab bar navigation. Great for main app sections.

drawer.title: Drawer
drawer.description: Side menu navigation. Perfect for docs and admin panels.

web.title: Web
web.description: Uses react-router-dom under the hood. URLs are real browser URLs with proper history management and deep linking.

native.title: Native
native.description: Uses @react-navigation/native with platform-specific transitions, gestures, and native navigation patterns.

routes.title: Routes Configuration
routes.description: Learn how to define and configure routes for your application.

basicRoutes.title: Basic Routes
basicRoutes.description: Define simple routes with path and component.

nestedRoutes.title: Nested Routes
nestedRoutes.description: Create hierarchical navigation structures with nested routes.

routeParams.title: Route Parameters
routeParams.description: Pass and receive parameters between routes.

useNavigator.title: useNavigator Hook
useNavigator.description: Programmatic navigation using the useNavigator hook.

navigate.title: navigate()
navigate.description: Navigate to a specific route by path or name.

goBack.title: goBack()
goBack.description: Go back to the previous route in the stack.

replace.title: replace()
replace.description: Replace the current route without adding to history.

currentRoute.title: Current Route
currentRoute.description: Access information about the current route.
